issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

resolution.description: A fix for this issue is checked into the tree and tested.
resolution.name: Fixed

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.
status.name: Resolved

fields.description:
If you run RM's Cluster Applications API with no query parameters, you get a list of apps.
If you run RM's Cluster Applications API with any query parameters other than "queue" you get the list of apps with the parameter filters being applied.
However, when you use the "queue" query parameter, you only see the applications that are active in the cluster (NEW, NEW_SAVING, SUBMITTED, ACCEPTED, RUNNING).  This behavior is inconsistent with the API.  If there is a sound reason behind this, it should be documented and it seems like there might be as the mapred queue CLI behaves similarly.

http://hadoop.apache.org/docs/stable/hadoop-yarn/hadoop-yarn-site/ResourceManagerRest.html#Cluster_Applications_API
fields.summary: RM Apps API returns only active apps when query parameter queue used

comments.body:
It's kind of logical, that if you define the _queue_ parameter you wish to see the applications actually in the queue. As I see it, there might be several possible solutions:
# Update the documentation to something like this: "queue - applications that are currently in this queue"
# Return all the applications that were submitted to that queue 
# Introduce another query parameter that returns all the applications that were submitted to a queue

Any thoughts?

I feel like 2 is the right solution because you can also pass `states` as a parameter and include NEW, NEW_SAVING, SUBMITTED, ACCEPTED, and RUNNING.  1 is the easiest to do.  Don't see any value with doing 3.

Check YARN-807: it changed the implementation from what I described in point 2 to reading the applications from the scheduler for performance reasons. Based on this, I think option 1 (updating the documentation) is the right thing to do.
I think its better we document for now rather changing behavior. For more data (such as pending), we can add new query param if needed and that could be done as improvement.
I agree.  After reading YARN-807, we should clearly document this behavior as different to the rest of the how the API works.
Patch #1: modified the description of the _queue_ parameter in the documentation of the Cluster Applications API for clarity.
Any opinions about this? Personally I wouldn't like to change the format of the list for this single item. What would you say if we added the note to the description before the list?
Yeah, that is a better approach.  I assume you're referring to the paragraph under "Query Parameters Supported".
